com.satori.rtm.connection

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.satori.rtm.connection.Connection

  • public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
    Access the RTM Service on the connection level to connect to the RTM Service, send and receive PDUs, and wait for responses from the RTM Service.

    Create a Connection with the create(URI, TransportFactory, Serializer) method.

    Code Example 

     
 Connection connection = Connection.create(new URI("<ENDPOINT>?appkey=<APP_KEY>"),
                                           new WebSocketTransportFactory());
 connection.connect(new ConnectionListener() { ... });

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Connection create(java.net.URI uri,
                                TransportFactory transportFactory,
                                Serializer serializer)
                         throws TransportException
        Creates a Connection object for a specific RTM Service endpoint URI.
        Parameters:
        uri - RTM Service endpoint.
        transportFactory - Transport factory.
        serializer - Json serializer/deserializer.
        Returns:
        Connection.
        Throws:
        TransportException - Could not create transport for the URI.

      • connect

        public void connect(ConnectionListener listener,
                    java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService dispatcher)
             throws TransportException
        Connects to the RTM Service, using the connection created with and performs transport-specific connect operations.

        For example, the method performs the WebSocket handshake and establishes the WebSocket connection.

        Parameters:
        listener - Implementation of the ConnectionListener.
        dispatcher - Construct that waits for and dispatches events from transport. Could be null. In this case all events will be fired from transport thread.
        Throws:
        TransportException - Transport cannot connect.

      • getListener

        public ConnectionListener getListener()
        Returns the ConnectionListener for the current Connection object.
        Returns:
        ConnectionListener.

      • sendNoAck

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<java.lang.Void> sendNoAck(java.lang.String operation,
                                                                                    java.lang.Object body)
        Asynchronously sends a Protocol Data Unit (PDU) to the RTM Service without acknowledge from the RTM Service.

        This method combines the specified operation with the PDU body into a PDU and sends it to the RTM Service. The PDU body must be able to be serialized into a JSON object.

        The ListenableFuture returned by this method is complete when the request is sent to the RTM Service.

        Parameters:
        operation - PDU operation, for example, "rtm/publish".
        body - PDU body.
        Returns:
        Result of an asynchronous send operation.

      • send

        public <T> com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<T>> send(java.lang.String operation,
                                                                           java.lang.Object body,
                                                                           java.lang.Class<T> responseClazz)
        Asynchronously sends a Protocol Data Unit (PDU) to the RTM Service.

        This method combines the specified operation with the PDU body into a PDU and sends it to the RTM Service. The PDU body must be able to be serialized into a JSON object.

        With this method, use the responseClazz parameter to specify the format of the PDU body returned by the RTM Service. The body of the PDU is converted to the format responseClazz parameter before it is returned.

        The ListenableFuture returned by this method is complete when the PDU response is received from the RTM Service.

        The ListenableFuture can fail due to the following error:

        • PduException - The RTM Service returns a negative response.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of response class.
        Parameters:
        operation - PDU operation, for example, "rtm/publish".
        body - PDU body.
        responseClazz - Instance of the response class.
        Returns:
        Result of an asynchronous send operation.

      • sendWithCallback

        public <T> void sendWithCallback(java.lang.String operation,
                                 java.lang.Object body,
                                 java.lang.Class<T> responseClazz,
                                 Callback<Pdu<T>> callback)
        Asynchronously sends a Protocol Data Unit (PDU) to the RTM Service. The typed response from the RTM Service is passed to the callback.

        This method combines the specified operation with the PDU body into a PDU and sends it to the RTM Service. The PDU body must be able to be serialized into a JSON object.

        With this method, use the responseClazz parameter to specify the format of the PDU body returned by the RTM Service. The body of the PDU is converted to the format responseClazz parameter before it is returned.

        This method should be used when RTM sends multiple PDUs response. All incoming PDUs from the RTM Service will be passed to Callback.onResponse(Object).

        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of response class.
        Parameters:
        operation - PDU operation, for example, "rtm/publish".
        body - PDU body.
        responseClazz - Instance of the response class.
        callback - The callback to invoke when response is received.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Stops a specific connection and releases all allocated resources. All communication with the RTM Service stops when you call this method and the events are not propagated to any listeners.

        In general, use this method after the connection to the RTM Service is already closed and you need to clean up resources.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes a specific connection. The TransportListener.onDisconnected() event is propagated to all listeners.
